title: AP News Summary at 5:02 p.m. EDT
creator: AP
content: Harrowing stories of rescue emerge from Texas floods as crews search for over 160 reported missing HUNT, Texas (AP) — Texas police described some of the harrowing rescues they conducted after flash floods engulfed camps and homes in the state's Hill Country. An officer who was trapped himself spotted dozens of people stranded on roofs and waded out to bring them to safety. That's according to a fellow officer who spoke Wednesday to a news conference. Another off-duty officer tied a garden hose around his waist so he could reach two people clinging to a tree above swirling floodwaters. More than 160 people still are believed to be missing and at least 118 have died in the floods. The floods are now the deadliest from inland flooding in the U.S. since 1976. Biden's former doctor refuses to answer questions in House Republican probe WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden’s White House physician is refusing to answer questions as part of the House Republican investigation into Biden’s health in office. Dr. Kevin O’Connor invoked his rights under the Fifth Amendment during a closed-door interview Wednesday before the House Oversight Committee. Oversight Chair Rep. James Comer of Kentucky says O’Connor’s refusal to testify makes it “clear there was a conspiracy.” Republicans are probing Biden’s actions in office and questioning whether the Democrat's use of an autopen may have been invalid. Biden has called the claims “ridiculous and false.” The Oversight committee’s top Democrat,...

title: 桐生市庁舎工事の入札妨害 3人起訴
Man charged after 3-year-old relative tests positive for fentanyl after July 4 trip in Orange County
creator: Travis Schlepp
content: A Las Vegas man faces felony charges for child abuse and endangerment after his young relative was rushed to an Orange County hospital after overdosing on fentanyl.Eric Duane Bird, 41, is accused of keeping potentially deadly narcotics in his bag during a family trip to Newport Beach over the Fourth of July weekend. Those drugs, according to the Orange County District Attorney's Office, ended up in the hands of a 3-year-old relative who was staying at the same short-term rental property as Bird and his wife and children.It's alleged that the boy found and ingested some of the drugs and overdosed on fentanyl, struggling to breathe and turning blue as his frantic parents dialed 911. The boy was taken by ambulance to the Children's Hospital of Orange County and needed to be revived with the emergency anti-overdose drug naloxone, commonly known as Narcan.FILE - A container of Narcan, a brand name version of the opioid overdose-reversal drug naloxone, is shown on Friday, Sept. 8, 2023, in Washington. (AP Photo/Mark Schiefelbein, File)The boy was also suffering from extreme itching, which led to medical crews administering epinephrine in an attempt to stop a potentially deadly allergic reaction. But it wasn't until naloxone was administered that the boy's condition improved, at which point he positively tested for fentanyl.Officers from the Newport Beach Police Department searched the rental property and found a backpack in Bird's room that contained burned foil, a device for...

title: Luka Modric head in hands for last game as Real Madrid fans look on in horror
creator: Jeremy Goldstein
content: As Real Madrid limped to a 3-0 first-half deficit against reigning UEFA Champions League-winners PSG in the Club World Cup semifinals, DAZN cameras panned to longtime midfielder Luka Modric, stuck on the Madrid bench. Wednesday was his last game for the club before his August move to AC Milan . The Croatian international, sitting next to his longtime friend and teammate Lucas Vazquez, looked like a pained man as Los Blancos quickly fell 2-0 down within the game's opening 10 minutes. Modric sat with his head in his hands, eventually moving them slightly to reveal a man wraught with grief. Modric — featured most commonly the backs of Los Blancos supporters throughout the tournament — entered to a roar of applause from the Real Madrid fans in the 65th minute. The crowd at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey, featured almost exclusively fans of the Spanish giants (sans for a pocket of PSG ultras behind one of the goals). Jeers were audible every time the Parisian side dallied on the ball in the second half, or when Madrid winger Vinicius Jr took one too many dribbles without passing in the final third. The 39-year-old is set to join Italian giants AC Milan at the conclusion of the tournament, a move the he hopes will prove to many that he is showing no signs of slowing down. This will mark the end of his 13-year journey with Real Madrid. Though not officially confirmed by Milan, their manager Max Allegri spoke about the player in his first press conference of the...

title: Delineation: Delta Communities Threaten To Disrupt Oil Facilities Over Alleged Marginalisation
creator: Leadership News
content: Ogbe-Ijoh oil producing communities in Warri South West Local Government Area of Delta State, have threatened to disrupt further flow of oil and gas from the communities, if the injustice against them are not addressed by the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) over the shortchanged delineation of wards in their local government. This threat is not unconnected to the seeming marginalisstion of its people over the Supreme Court ordered fresh delineation of electoral wards and polling units in the area by the (INEC). In a statement signed on Wednesday by Deacon Clement Tekedor, Chief Samson Oyimi Emmanuel Kusimi, and Hon Johnbull Aniyanghan, the group noted that by the records of the National Population Commission (NPC), Ogbe-Ijoh has the highest population, landmass and settlements/communities in Warri South West Local Government Area. The statement added that Ogbe-Ijoh Kingdom settlements and communities constitute One Hundred and Sixteen (116) Localities (after removing Diebiri Clan) out of the Two Hundred and Ninety (290) Localities in the entire Warri South West Local Government in the National Population Commission (NPC) Housing and Locality Enumeration Report, 2023, which represents about 40% of the entire local government area. The communities added that there is no record anywhere showing that Gbaramatu Kingdom is five (5) times bigger than Ogbe-Ijoh Kingdom. “There is also no record anywhere to the effect that, the Itsekiri Communities in Warri South...

title: Want to buy an EV or get rooftop solar? What Trump’s megabill means for you
content: SAN DIEGO (TNS)— The so-called One Big Beautiful Bill could lead to a big, mad dash for consumers looking to buy electric vehicles or install rooftop solar before federal tax incentives expire in the coming months. Led by Republicans on Capitol Hill and signed into law by President Donald Trump on July 4, the 940-page legislation affects taxes and spending on multiple elements of the nation’s economy — including the energy and auto industries. It rolls back major pieces of 2022’s Inflation Reduction Act that was pushed through by congressional Democrats and former President Joe Biden. title: Gov. Abbott orders special session on Hill Country flooding, redistricting, THC and unfinished GOP priorities
content: Gov. Greg Abbott on Wednesday unveiled a jam-packed agenda for the upcoming special legislative session, calling on legislators to redraw the state's congressional maps and address several unfinished conservative priorities from earlier this year. The governor, who controls the agenda for overtime legislative sessions, also included four items related to the deadly Hill Country floods over the July Fourth weekend, directing lawmakers to look at flood warning systems, emergency communications, natural disaster preparation and relief funding for the impacted areas. title: Greatest Fourth Road Race Action
creator: mdunn@missaukeesentinel.com (Mike Dunn)
content: The 2025 Greatest Fourth in the North road races drew nearly 700 participants, the largest field in recent years to converge on the downtown city park. Runners ranged in age from 7 to the 70s, many of them displaying patriotic colors in various forms. After taking part in the 2K fun run, the 5K race, or the 10K race, the participants enjoyed some watermelon or orange slices with bottled water. The top three finishers in each age bracket earned a medal and the male and female champions of the 5K and 10K each received a trophy. PHOTOS BY MIKE DUNN

title: Ontario bakers look to heat up friendly competition with B.C. over Nanaimo bar record
creator: Natasha Baldin The Canadian Press
content: In the kitchen of Northwest Fudge Factory in Levack, Ont., a group of five children spent the better part of a day last month mixing hundreds of kilograms of butter, sugar, chocolate and graham crackers before carefully spreading distinct layers on top of each other. The result was a 544-kilogram Nanaimo bar that they claimed was the largest ever made. The group snatched an unofficial record set just weeks earlier, when culinary arts students at Vancouver Island University in Nanaimo, B.C., created a confection weighing just 45 kilograms less. The fudge factory says they received some biting messages from the dessert’s namesake community after announcing the feat. The same group of Ontario kids already holds the current Guinness World Record for the largest Nanaimo bar after they baked a 240-kilogram bar back in 2020. Chantelle Gorham, one of the owners of the fudge factory, says she chose not to go through the process of recording the latest endeavour in the Guinness record books because they want Nanaimo residents to claim it. “We understand that the Nanaimo bar is near and dear to Nanaimo, B.C., and this is something they should be very proud of,” said Gorham, whose kids were part of the Ontario baking team. The Nanaimo students didn’t follow the Guinness verification process either, instead relying on validation through the Baking Association of Canada and the Culinary Association of Canada. After hearing about “nasty emails” being sent to the Ontario fudge factory,...

As an expert on , I believe that these changing regional dynamics give the Lebanese state an opening to chart a more neutral orientation and extricate itself from neighboring conflicts that have long exacerbated the divided and fragile country’s chronic problems. title: A weakened Iran and Hezbollah gives Lebanon an opening to chart path away from the region’s conflicts − will it be enough?
creator: Mireille Rebeiz - Dickinson College
content: (The Conversation is an independent and nonprofit source of news, analysis and commentary from academic experts.) Mireille Rebeiz , Dickinson College (THE CONVERSATION) After a 12-day war launched by Israel and joined briefly by the United States, Iran has emerged weakened and vulnerable . And that has massive implications for another country in the region: Lebanon. Hezbollah, Tehran’s main ally in Lebanon, had already lost a lot of its fighters, arsenal and popular support during its own war with Israel in October 2024. Now, Iran’s government has little capacity to continue to finance, support and direct Hezbollah in Lebanon like it has done in the past. Compounding this shift away from Hezbollah’s influence, the U.S. recently laid down terms for a deal that would see the withdrawal of Israeli troops from southern Lebanon in return for the total disarmament of the paramilitary group – a proposal seemingly backed by the Lebanese government. As an expert on Lebanese history and culture , I believe that these changing regional dynamics give the Lebanese state an opening to chart a more neutral orientation and extricate itself from neighboring conflicts that have long exacerbated the divided and fragile country’s chronic problems. The shaping of modern Lebanon Ideologically, developments in Iran played a major role in shaping the circumstances in which Hezbollah, the Shiite Islamist political party and paramilitary group , was born. The Iranian Revolution of 1978-79 toppled the...

title: Grok’s antisemitic rant shows how generative AI can be weaponized
creator: James Foulds - University of Maryland, Baltimore County, Phil Feldman - University of Maryland, Baltimore County, Shimei Pan - University of Maryland, Baltimore County
content: (The Conversation is an independent and nonprofit source of news, analysis and commentary from academic experts.) James Foulds , University of Maryland, Baltimore County ; Phil Feldman , University of Maryland, Baltimore County , and Shimei Pan , University of Maryland, Baltimore County (THE CONVERSATION) The AI chatbot Grok went on an antisemitic rant on July 8, 2025, posting memes, tropes and conspiracy theories used to denigrate Jewish people on the X platform. It also invoked Hitler in a favorable context. The episode follows one on May 14, 2025, when the chatbot spread debunked conspiracy theories about “white genocide” in South Africa, echoing views publicly voiced by Elon Musk , the founder of its parent company, xAI. While there has been substantial research on methods for keeping AI from causing harm by avoiding such damaging statements – called AI alignment – these incidents are particularly alarming because they show how those same techniques can be deliberately abused to produce misleading or ideologically motivated content. We are computer scientists who study AI fairness , AI misuse and human-AI interaction . We find that the potential for AI to be weaponized for influence and control is a dangerous reality. The Grok incidents In the July episode, Grok posted that a person with the last name Steinberg was celebrating the deaths in the Texas flooding and added : “Classic case of hate dressed as activism — and that surname? Every damn time, as they say.” In...

title: Vai iespējams atgūt tūkstošiem eiro par OIK? Juristi atbild uz 13 jautājumiem par šo procesu
content: Ja reiz maksājums par elektrības obligātā iepirkuma komponenti (OIK) atzīts par nelikumīgu, kāpēc valsts to neatmaksā cilvēkiem? Kāpēc jāiesaista tiesas un advokāti? Vai viņiem var uzticēties? Vai ir iespējams, ka juristiem par šo pakalpojumu būs jāmaksā vairāk, nekā izdosies izcīnīt? Kāpēc par savu kļūdu nemaksā politiķi un ierēdņi, kuri to ieviesa? Kas notiek, ja cilvēks maksāja OIK un nomira – vai šo summu varēs piedzīt mantinieki?

title: Estētikai – 1500 eiro, medicīnai – bez maksas. Vai un kad plakstiņu operāciju sedz valsts?
content: Gadu gaitā daudzi pamana – skatiens nebūt vairs nav tik možs kā agrāk, plakstiņi kļūst smagnēji, āda noslīd, acis izskatās nogurušas. Tas ne vien ietekmē izskatu, bet arī pašsajūtu, pārliecību par sevi un dažkārt pat redzes kvalitāti. Par laimi, šai problēmai ir risinājums – blefaroplastika jeb augšējo plakstiņu operācija. Šajā rakstā skaidrosim, vai un kad acu plakstiņu korekciju iespējams veikt par valsts līdzekļiem, cik tā izmaksā privāti, vai plakstiņu noslīdēšana patiešām ietekmē redzi, kādi ir iespējamie riski un kā galu galā norit atveseļošanās process.

title: Skamania County Auditor announces special candidate filing period
creator: Skamania County Elections media release
content: STEVENSON — The Skamania County Auditor’s Office will open a special 3-day candidate filing period from July 14–16 for offices open for election in 2025 that had no filings during the regular filing period held in May. Offices open for this special filing period include: Mt. Pleasant School District No. 29 (Director Position No. 2), Skamania School District No. 2 (Director Position No. 1), Skamania School District No. 2 (Director Position No. 3), Stevenson-Carson School District No. 303 (Director Position No. 1, 2-year unexpired term), Metropolitan Park and Recreation District (Commissioner No. 2), and the Skamania Park and Recreation District No. 1 (Commissioner No. 2). Candidates are encouraged to file online, but declarations can also be accepted in person. Additional information, including filing fees and incumbent information, is available on the Auditor’s Office website (www.skamaniacounty.org/elections) or in the office located at 240 NW Vancouver Ave,. Room 27, in Stevenson. For more information on local filing, voters can call the Elections Department at 509-427-3730, email elections@co.skamania.wa.us , or visit www.skamaniacounty.org/elections .

title: Seven Oklahoma lawmakers score 100% on pro-growth report
creator: Jeff Elkins
content: Summary: – New Prosperity Tracker app replaces RIED Report to show votes. – Seven legislators earned a perfect 100% pro-growth rating. – Bills scored include measures on workforce and contracting. OKLAHOMA CITY — An evaluation by the State Chamber Research Foundation gave the Oklahoma legislature a 73% pro-growth score for the 2025 session. The foundation releases an annual assessment grading lawmakers and legislation on pro-growth and pro- business merits. This year, the chamber took a new approach with the Prosperity Tracker, formerly the RIED Report, an app that tracks the voting of state legislators on measures identified by the research foundation as pro-growth. “This year’s Prosperity Tracker gives companies the opportunity to see how legislators voted on key issues that affect the business community,” said Jake Yunker, executive director of the State Chamber Research Foundation. “This is a great tool to show how legislators are voting as well as an opportunity for companies to engage with those lawmakers to better explain the positions taken by the business community.” Lawmakers are graded according to their vote on bills related to business, industry, job creation and economic growth. The legislature as a whole received a 73% pro-growth score, with seven legislators receiving a perfect score, and forty scoring higher than 90% on the assessment. State Rep. Mike Osburn, R-Edmond, state Rep. Tammy West, R-Oklahoma City, state Sen. Christi Gillespie, R-Broken Arrow,...

title: Colorado coach Deion Sanders declines to address health issues at Big 12 media days
creator: By STEPHEN HAWKINS - AP Sports Writer
content: FRISCO, Texas (AP) — Deion Sanders declined to address his health at Big 12 football media days Wednesday, which came during his extended absence from Colorado. “I'm not here to talk about my health,” said Sanders, who is going into his third season as the Buffaloes coach. “I'm here to talk about my team.” Since overseeing Colorado’s spring game April 19, Sanders hadn’t attended football camps in Boulder. The school had said last month, amid reports that the coach was ill, that it could not say why he was absent. Sanders did not specifically answer any questions about his health. “I’m looking good. I’m living lovely. God has truly blessed me,” he said. “Not a care in the world. Not a want or desire in the world.” Sanders was the last of the league's 16 coaches to appear on the main stage over two days at the headquarters of the NFL’s Dallas Cowboys, which is about 75 miles from the sprawling ranch that the Pro Football Hall of Fame player has in Canton, Texas. During his question-and-answer session that lasted nearly 17 minutes, Sanders addressed topics such as his coaching staff, quarterbacks and even Texas Tech coach Joey McGuire. Sanders then returned to the stage for a roundtable discussion with the other seven coaches in attendance Wednesday, but he didn't take part in his media breakout session scheduled for each coach at the end of the day. It was unclear if the latest health issues are new. Sanders, a month shy of his 58th birthday, has struggled with his left foot...

title: Concord man arrested, arraigned in court following sexual assault investigation
content: A Concord man was arraigned in court on Tuesday on charges of felonious sexual assault, computer uses prohibited and breach of bail. Zaymen Burdette, 19, was out on bail for previous sexual assault and drug dealing charges at the time of his second arrest. Burdette was originally the subject of a multi-month investigation concerning allegations of sexual assault and drug dealing last year. Authorities arrested him in January 2025 on possession of a controlled drug with intent to distribute, certain uses of a computer prohibited, contribution to the delinquency of a minor and three sexual assault charges. He was then released on bail. In March 2025, the Concord Police Department opened another sexual assault investigation that led to new charges against Burdette, including two counts of felonious sexual assault involving a victim aged 13-15, two misdemeanor counts of breach of bail and one felonious use of computer prohibited. Police took him into custody on July 7. After refusing to cooperate with the booking process, Burdette was transferred to the Merrimack County House of Corrections, where he is currently being held on preventative detention following his arraignment. Abby DiSalvo can be reached at adisalvo@cmonitor.com

content: 붐비는 제주공항 [연합뉴스 자료사진] [연합뉴스 자료사진] 여름 휴가철이 다가오는 가운데 제주 지역 항공·숙박·렌터카 관련 소비자 피해가 매년 늘어나는 것으로 나타나 한국소비자원이 오늘(10일) 소비자 피해 예방 주의보를 발령했습니다. 한국소비자원에 따르면 지난해 접수된 제주 지역 항공·숙박·렌터카 관련 피해구제 사건은 626건으로 2022년 422건, 2023년 475건에 이어 매년 증가하는 추세입니다. 3년간 접수된 피해구제 1,523건을 분석한 결과, 월별로 보면 여름 휴가가 집중되는 8월이 233건으로 가장 많았습니다. 이 가운데 항공 관련 피해구제 사건은 739건을 차지했습니다. 유형별로는 '항공권 취소 위약금' 피해가 53.7%로 가장 많았고, '운항 지연, 불이행' 19.8%, '수하물 파손, 분실' 6.8% 등 순이었습니다. 항공권 취소·위약금 피해가 많은 이유는 전자상거래로 구매한 항공권은 '전자상거래법'에 따른 청약철회 대상임에도 불구하고 일부 사업자가 청약철회를 거부하기 때문인 것으로 나타났습니다. 환불 불가 조건의 특가 항공권과 기한이 임박한 항공권은 환불 또는 청약철회가 제한될 수도 있는데, 이와 관련해 분쟁이 발생하는 경우도 많았습니다. 지난 3년간 접수된 제주 지역 숙박 관련 피해구제는 모두 420건이었습니다. 이 가운데 '예약 취소 위약금' 피해가 71.7%으로 가장 많았고, 다음으로 '시설 불만족' 피해가 11.7%로 나타났습니다. 숙박 예약취소 위약금 분쟁은 사업자가 성수기 등의 명목으로 위약금을 과다하게...

title: Governor signs measure expanding MSSU's statewide mission
content: Missouri Gov. Mike Kehoe signed legislation Wednesday expanding the statewide mission of Missouri Southern State University. According to a university statement, in a ceremony at the state capital, Kehoe signed Senate Concurrent Resolution 3 and Senate Bill 150 "formally recognizing MSSU’s emerging leadership in health and life sciences, as well as immersive learning. This adds to the university’s mission in international education, which has been in place since 1995.

title: Guna Pudule: Rīgas skolu direktori bija šokā, uzzinot par šiem grozījumiem
content: Vasaras un atvaļinājumu laikā Izglītības un zinātnes ministrija (IZM) virza grozījumus Ministru kabineta noteikumos par mērķdotāciju sadali pedagogu darba samaksai. Šie noteikumi ir pārāk būtiski, lai tos pieņemtu bez plašas nozares iesaistes. Tie skars ne tikai skolu direktorus, bet visu izglītības iestādes vadības komandu, turklāt samazinās finansējumu uz vienu skolēnu konkrētās klašu grupās, un noteikti samazinās arī pedagoga algu par likmi. Galu galā – šie grozījumi ietekmēs arī mācību kvalitāti kopumā.

title: East Peoria dentist dies in skydiving accident in Ottawa
creator: ROBYN GAUTSCHY SKAGGS robyn.skaggs@lee.net
content: OGLESBY — A dentist from East Peoria died in a skydiving accident Monday evening near Ottawa. LaSalle County Coroner Richard Ploch on Wednesday identified the man as Dr. Noel Liu, 48. Ploch's news release said the LaSalle County Coroner's Office had been called to Skydive Chicago early Monday evening for a report of a "male decedent who had been involved in a skydiving accident." An autopsy was conducted Tuesday, but results, including toxicology testing, were still pending Wednesday, the news release said. The incident remains under investigation by the LaSalle County Coroner’s Office and the LaSalle County Sheriff’s Office, with assistance from the National Transportation Safety Board and the Federal Aviation Administration. Liu is listed as founder and CEO of Secure Dental on the company's website. The dental practice is on Riverside Drive in East Peoria. Liu graduated from the NYU College of Dentistry, according to the website. Fellow Secure Dental founder and CEO Dr. Nazish Jafri shared a statement on the "Noel Liu, DDS" page on Facebook on Tuesday afternoon. "It is with a heavy heart that I share the news of Noel's sudden passing during a skydiving adventure last evening. He lived a life full of fulfillment and satisfaction, always pursuing his passions with enthusiasm and courage," she wrote. "Noel touched the lives of many with his warmth and enthusiasm, leaving behind cherished memories that will be treasured forever. He was an amazing father, husband, son, brother,...

title: HD33 GOP nominee to be chosen district committee by end of July
creator: By Ryan Fitzmaurice The Northern Virginia Daily
content: The Republican nominee for House District 33 will likely be selected by the end of July by a four-member committee representing each county in the district. With the majority of the weighted vote, Shenandoah County, represented by Sheriff Timothy Carter, holds the deciding share. The committee, which includes one representative each from Shenandoah, Page, Rockingham, and Warren counties, met Tuesday night at the Shenandoah County Sheriff’s Office and unanimously agreed to open a call for candidates this week, followed by public interviews on July 29 and a final vote to select the nominee. If all interviews cannot be completed that evening, the meeting will recess and resume on July 31. A formal call for candidates is expected by Friday. Prospective nominees must submit written declarations of candidacy by 5 p.m. on July 18. “This is your role. You have the burden of responsibility,” Committee Chair Vito Gentile told members. “And you have to do it in whatever way enables you to do it in good conscience.” Gentile said the process is not new and has been laid out in the Republican Party of Virginia’s plan for at least 15 years.The party plan directs Legislative District Committees to select a nominee when a certified candidate withdraws after the primary deadline, as occurred when Delegate Todd Gilbert stepped down as the candidate earlier this month following his appointment by President Donald Trump to U.S. Attorney. While each county has one representative, votes are...

title: Regan Hunt ends high school career with triple-sport success
creator: MILO WHITMAN Anacortes American
content: Regan Hunt poses for a photo at Anacortes High School's track on Friday, June 27. Regan Hunt is something of a rarity in high school sports. In an era in which the best athletes are encouraged to commit to a single sport in order to master it, the Anacortes High School senior not only played three sports, she dominated in them. She earned second-team all-Northwest Conference honors in volleyball, second-team all-Northwest Conference honors in basketball and placed among the top 10 in two events — the triple jump and shot put — at the Class 2A state track and field meet. Being able to shift gears so quickly from one sport to another can be difficult. Hunt credits her background in competitive dance with her success in sports. “My mom and I talk all the time about how much I think dancing helped me so much coming into multiple sports because it just helps me with so many different things," she said. "Like coordination and flexibility, honestly, and all that kind of stuff. It made moving between different things so much easier.” Hunt did competitive dance from the ages of 8 to 15. She considered hip-hop to be her best style, but also performed tap, ballet, jazz, breakdancing and hula. Dance was a year-round activity for Hunt, running alongside the seasonal sport at the time. She remembers hurrying from track meets straight to dance competitions. She grew accustomed to jumping between sports. Regan Hunt competes in the girls' triple jump in May at Lakewood High School. Track was...

title: We could see the ASX 200 at 9,000 points by 2026. Here's why.
content: By most measures, the S&P/ASX 200 Index (ASX: XJO) has had a great year in 2025.For one, the index has recovered from its 2025 lows to hit new all-time highs this year, the most recent of which was the 8,639.1 point high watermark we saw earlier this month.Yesterday, the ASX 200 closed just short of that all-time high at just above 8,538.60 points.For another, we've seen a bevvy of prominent blue chip ASX 200 shares hit new highs of their own. The most famous of these (or perhaps infamous, depending on who you speak to) is, of course, Commonwealth Bank of Australia (ASX: CBA).But we've also been multi-year, or record, highs for shares ranging from National Australia Bank Ltd (ASX: NAB) and Coles Group Ltd (ASX: COL) to Telstra Group Ltd (ASX: TLS) and Wesfarmers Ltd (ASX: WES).Today, many of these shares look expensive, and are trading on some of their lowest dividend yields we've seen in a very long time.It's arguably quite difficult to find bargain buys on the ASX today.Even so, I still wouldn't be surprised if the ASX 200 keeps on climbing this year. We could even see the index break 9,000 points for the first time ever.Why? Well, it comes down to one factor – interest rates.At the start of 2025, the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) had the cash rate at a 13-year high of 4.35%.However, thanks to a rate cut in February and another in May, the cash rate now sits at 3.85%. Most commentators expected the RBA to go three for three this week. However, to most experts' surprise,...

title: Six months in, Rep. Moore recovers more than $2 million for taxpayers
creator: By Steven Allen Adams For The Journal
content: CHARLESTON – More than six months after he first took office in the U.S. House of Representatives, 2nd District Congressman Riley Moore has already recovered more than $2 million on behalf of constituents. Moore’s office announced Tuesday that his constituent services staff in Morgantown and Martinsburg have helped recover more than $2 million from various federal agencies for taxpayers since taking office on Jan. 3. “My office is eager to help constituents of the Second District in dealing with the frustrations of the federal bureaucracy,” said Moore, R-W.Va. “I’m so proud of the work we’re doing and am thrilled to report this massive figure only six months into my term.” The $2 million represents funds owed to constituents in the 2nd Congressional District by federal departments and agencies, such as owed compensation, retroactive payments, pensions and other outstanding payments. Some of the taxpayer funds returned to constituents after being withheld include more than $1 million from the Department of Agriculture, more than $900,000 from the Internal Revenue Service, more than $320,000 from the Social Security Administration, more than $25,000 from the Department of Veterans Affairs, more than $20,000 from the Department of Defense and more than $12,500 from the Office of Personnel Management. According to the Congressional Research Service (CRS), common casework requests to congressional offices can include help with applications for Social Security, veterans or other...

title: From the archives – Scouts enjoying summer and barbecue season is in full swing
content: Messenger File Photo ST. ALBANS — As part of our ongoing work to digitize our film archives, here is a set of photos taken 50 years ago during this week in July of 1975. Boy Scouts pose for the camera in shots emblematic of summertime cheer. In one photo, three of them are draped around a wooden, triangular structure they probably built. What did you do as a Scout in the 70s in Franklin County? We would love to learn more about this tradition. July 4 1975 It’s barbecue season, and it looks like just about everyone is grabbing something to eat in this week’s photos. A stylish woman sips from a plastic cup in one photo while children play yard games. If you look closely, you can also spot a girl horseback riding! If you or someone you know is featured in one of our photo sets, let us know at the email for this project, archives@samessenger.com , or by calling the office at 802-524-9771, option 3.

title: Economic impact of Oklahoma higher ed tops $14 billion, study finds
creator: By Emma Murphy Oklahoma Voice Special to The Banner
content: OKLAHOMA CITY — Every dollar the Oklahoma Legislature invests in the state’s public higher education system produces over $17 in economic output, a new study found. Oklahoma public higher education supported over 111,000 jobs either directly or indirectly and produced over $460 million in tax revenue at state, county and local levels, according to the study published by the Oklahoma State Regents for Higher Education. The regents contracted with the University of Cincinnati Economics Center to conduct the study. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content. Режиссер рассказал о съемках Артемия Лебедева в фильме ужасов «Мора»
creator: Марина Галушка
content: Режиссер фильма ужасов «Мора» Даниил Тигулев рассказал о работе на площадке с Артемием Лебедевым. Тигулев признался, что «Мора» стала его первым полнометражным художественным фильмом. «Мы изначально хотели снять ужасы - классический жанровый слэшер, где группа юных ребят едет на отдых и попадает в западню. Зумеры - это просто часть этой формулы. Для Артемия это не дебют в кино. У него уже есть роль в фильме «Я съем твою собаку». С Артемием работалось отлично. На самом деле, как с любым известным и востребованным человеком - все четко по плану, без лишних разговоров и задержек. Он очень приятный человек. Был рад познакомиться с ним при таких обстоятельствах. Не буду раскрывать никаких подробностей его роли - все увидите в фильме», - рассказал режиссер в эфире НСН. Он также поблагодарил Хофманниту за то, что она выдержала физически непростые съемки. «Ей отдельно мой низкий поклон. У нее были физически трудные сцены: очень много бега по лесу в обуви на платформе, падения, ледяная вода. Не обошлось без ссадин и легких травм. Но она все выдержала и выдала перформанс, чем влюбила в себя всю съемочную группу. Думаю, зрители, знакомые с ней, приятно удивятся, увидев ее сцены», - поделился Тигулев. По его словам, точная дата релиза проекта пока неизвестна. «Фильм готов, мы все ждем точных дат премьеры. Предположительно, осенью этого года», - подытожил собеседник. Как сообщалось ранее, кинорежиссер Алексей Герман-младший заявил о том, что китайцам близка тема Второй...

title: Escorted home | Hill Country flood victim's body returned to Conroe so she can be laid to rest
content: MONTGOMERY COUNTY, Texas — A recent Conroe ISD graduate was among those who died in the catastrophic Texas Hill Country flooding over the Fourth of July weekend. Claire Reese Manchaca was with three of her friends in the Hill Country when the devastating flooding hit. They were last known to be near 1769 State Highway 39, across from Japonica Hills Road in Hunt. After an extensive search over several days, her body was found. On Wednesday, she was brought home to be laid to rest. RELATED: Texas flood death toll climbs to 111 as search continues | 161 people still missing The longtime friends were celebrating the holiday weekend in a cabin that was swept away by floodwaters. Manchaca's boyfriend, Aiden Heartfield, is still missing. Ella Cahill's body was found on Tuesday night, and Joyce Badon was found dead earlier this week. All five Montgomery County constable precincts sent deputies to Kerrville to escort Manchaca's body back home. "I want to thank all of our constables for answering the call and providing some comfort to the family during this difficult time," Montgomery County Judge Mark Keough said in a post on social media. Credit: KHOU Claire Reese Manchaca was among those who died in the Texas Hill Country flooding on the Fourth of July weekend in 2025. Keough said Manchaca was from Montgomery County and had recently graduated from Caney Creek High School. This morning all 5 constable precincts have sent deputies to Kerrville to escort Reese Manchaca back to...

title: FACT FOCUS: Trump misrepresents facts about wind power during Cabinet meeting
creator: Jennifer Mcdermott The Associated Press
content: President Donald Trump expressed his disdain for wind power during a meeting with his Cabinet recently, calling it an expensive form of energy that “smart” countries don’t use. His comments on Tuesday contained false and misleading information about the use of wind power in the United States and around the world, and came on the heels of an executive order he signed Monday that would end subsidies around “green” energy. Here’s a look at the facts. CLAIM: “Wind is a very expensive form of energy.” THE FACTS: Onshore wind is one of the cheapest sources of electricity generation, with new wind farms expected to produce electricity around $30 per megawatt hour. This compares to a new natural gas plant, around $65 per megawatt hour, or a new advanced nuclear reactor, which runs over $80, according to estimates from the Energy Information Administration. Onshore wind farms cost less to build and operate than natural gas plants on average in most regions of the United States, even without tax credits. Though natural gas plants are available to produce electricity at any time of the day, unlike wind. Offshore wind is among the sources of new power generation that will cost the most to build and operate, at $88 per megawatt hour, according to the EIA. While electricity rates have risen nationwide over the past decade, states that have added a significant amount of onshore wind power, such as Iowa, Kansas, Oklahoma and New Mexico, have kept rates from rising as fast as other states ,...

title: Daughter of the Moellers, Harley, confirmed dead along with grandparents
content: Right after the Wednesday edition of the Herald-Zeitung went to press on Tuesday, it was learned that the remaining family members of Jake and Megan Moeller were announced dead by the floods in Kerr County. Avery’s Kitchen in New Braunfels, where Megan Moeller worked as a server, posted the passing of all family members on its Facebook page, along with a GoFundMe link to help the family carry the weight of the funerals. On the GoFundMe page, which was organized by Megan’s sister, she stated, “On July 4th, our lives changed forever. In the early morning hours, a catastrophic flood in Ingram, Texas took five beloved members of our family, my Mother, DeeAnn, and my Stepfather, Gary, as well as my sister, Megan, her husband, and their young daughter, Harley. The grief is beyond words, and we are still trying to comprehend how to move forward without them. “My Husband and I never imagined having to ask for help like this. But no one expects to wake up and suddenly carry the weight of four funerals. On top of that, we’ve had to take on significant debt to ensure their estates are properly managed and their affairs are handled with the care they deserve. The financial burden is more than we can manage on our own, and we are doing everything we can to honor their lives and say goodbye with the dignity they deserve. “If you are able to support us in any way, please know that every gift will go directly toward these unexpected costs. Most of all, we are deeply grateful for your love,...

title: What to know about the ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’ cuts to Medicaid
creator: Ben Mause The Baltimore Sun (TNS)
content: Republicans passed the legislation Thursday after Congress pulled two all-nighters to meet Trump’s self-imposed July 4 deadline. A host of provisions were included in the spending package; chief among them were the permanent extension of the 2017 tax cuts, new tax breaks on overtime and tips, a $40,000 cap on state and local tax deductions, and $350 billion in funding for border security and defense. It will also make cuts to multiple social programs, including SNAP and Medicaid. The impact on Medicaid will be particularly significant, with Republican lawmakers cutting roughly $1 trillion from the program over the next decade by instituting more frequent eligibility checks and work requirements, among other policy shifts. The changes are predicted to cause 11.8 million people to lose their health care by 2034, according to the Congressional Budget Office. In Maryland, roughly 246,000 people are expected to lose their coverage. Here’s what to know about the Medicaid changes, who they will affect, and when they’ll be implemented. A chunk of the savings in the Medicaid portion of the bill will be caused by added red tape that states and residents will have to navigate to determine recipient eligibility. The new law requires states to increase the frequency of eligibility checks for Medicaid expansion recipients to once every six months. Under previous law, states were required to check eligibility yearly. The new process won’t be immediately enacted. It will start after Dec....

title: FACT FOCUS: Trump misrepresents facts about wind power during Cabinet meeting
content: President expressed his disdain for wind power during a meeting with his Cabinet recently, calling it an expensive form of energy that “smart” countries don't use. His comments on Tuesday contained false and misleading information about the use of wind power in the United States and around the world, and came on the heels of an executive order he signed Monday that would end subsidies around “green” energy. Here’s a look at the facts. CLAIM: “Wind is a very expensive form of energy.” THE FACTS: Onshore wind is one of the cheapest sources of electricity generation, with new wind farms expected to produce electricity around $30 per megawatt hour. This compares to a new natural gas plant, around $65 per megawatt hour, or a new advanced nuclear reactor, which runs over $80, according to estimates from the Energy Information Administration. Onshore wind farms cost less to build and operate than natural gas plants on average in most regions of the United States, even without tax credits. Though natural gas plants are available to produce electricity at any time of the day, unlike wind. Offshore wind is among the sources of new power generation that will cost the most to build and operate, at $88 per megawatt hour, according to the EIA. While electricity rates have risen nationwide over the past decade, states that have added a significant amount of onshore wind power, such as Iowa, Kansas, Oklahoma and New Mexico, , said Brendan Pierpont, director of electricity modeling at the...

title: AP Sports SummaryBrief at 4:55 p.m. EDT
content: Novak Djokovic reaches a record 14th Wimbledon semifinal and faces No. 1 Jannik Sinner next LONDON (AP) — Novak Djokovic has reached the Wimbledon semifinals for a men’s-record 14th time as he pursues his unprecedented 25th title from all Grand Slam tournaments. Djokovic beat Flavio Cobolli 6-7 (6), 6-2, 7-5, 6-4 on Wednesday to set up a showdown against No. 1 Jannik Sinner for a berth in the final. Sinner eliminated Ben Shelton 7-6 (2), 6-4, 6-4 and didn’t play like someone dealing with an injured right elbow. He used terrific serving and his usual booming forehand to win against Shelton for the sixth consecutive time. Sinner hurt his elbow in a fall during his fourth-round match against Grigor Dimitrov on Monday night. Red Bull fires F1 team principal Christian Horner after 20 title-filled years Longtime Red Bull team principal Christian Horner has been fired after a 20-year stint that included eight Formula 1 drivers’ titles. Red Bull did not give a reason for the decision in a statement Wednesday, but thanked Horner for his work and said he will “forever remain an important part of our team history.” Laurent Mekies of sister team Racing Bulls will replace Horner. Horner had been Red Bull team principal since it entered F1 as a full constructor in 2005. Valkyries rout the Fever 80-61 as Caitlin Clark struggles in her return from injury INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — Veronica Burton had 21 points, eight rebounds and six assists, Kayla Thornton added 18 points and eight boards, and...

title: Evenepoel's stuns with time trial victory as Pogacar grabs yellow jersey
Evenepoel's stuns with time trial victory as Pogacar grabs yellow jersey
content: CAEN, France — Race-against-the-clock specialist Remco Evenepoel produced a stunning display of power to win the first time trial of the Tour de France on Wednesday and defending champion Tadej Pogacar cemented his favorite status by grabbing the yellow jersey. Evenepoel, the reigning time trial Olympic and world champion, was expected to win the stage in the absence of time trial specialists — Filippo Ganna and Stefan Bissegger, who both crashed and exited the race on the first day of the Tour last week. The mainly flat 33-kilometer (20.5-mile) stage 5 in Normandy favored powerful riders like Evenepoel, who already had won a time trial in a similar fashion last year, when the Belgian rider finished third overall in the general classification. Evenepoel, who has fully recovered from multiple injuries sustained in a big crash last year, was 16 seconds faster than Pogacar. Edoardo Affini, the time trial European champion, was third, 33 seconds off the pace. Tucked on his bike in a perfect aerodynamic position, Evenepoel was in a class of his own. He made the most of the back wind in the second half of the race, reaching the finish at an average speed of more than 54 kph (33.5 mph). "I didn't really feel like I could go any faster," Evenepoel said. But the day's big winner was Pogacar, who was back in the yellow jersey a day after taking his 100th career win. The three-time Tour winner opened a big gap on his main rival Jonas Vingegaard, who endured a bad day and lost more than...

title: Jastrzemski: Enhanced CDL issues at airports being worked out
content: Niagara County Clerk Joseph A. Jastrzemski is updating residents on an issue with airport scanners that some residents who have Enhanced Commercial Driver’s Licenses have run into. Some scanners appear to be having problems reading the Enhanced CDLs. “Today, the state DMV advised county clerks that they have been working with the Transportation Security Administration to address the scanner issues with Enhanced Commercial Drivers’ Licenses and believe an update to the system later this month should solve the problem,” Jastrzemski said in a release. “In the meantime, TSA is advising those with Enhanced CDL’s to bring additional documentation with them to the airport.” Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content.

title: Analysis: House retirements so far are at a historical low
content: WASHINGTON — While senators are leaving Washington at a higher-than-normal pace, House retirements are lagging behind the historical average. But it’s still early, and second-quarter campaign finance reports, due July 15, could provide a window into departures to come. Thus far, 16 House members have announced they aren’t seeking reelection, but calling it an exodus or referring to all these exits as retirements wouldn’t be accurate. Thirteen of them are running for another office, including seven members who are attempting to move just a few steps across the Capitol to the Senate. The other six are running for governor, including Iowa Republican Randy Feenstra, who’s formed an exploratory committee but hasn’t formally announced a gubernatorial bid. Just three House members — Illinois Democrat Jan Schakowsky, Nebraska Republican Don Bacon and Pennsylvania Democrat Dwight Evans — are leaving at the end of their terms without running for something else. (Note: This list does not include resignations, with Tennessee Republican Mark E. Green expected to step down on July 20.) But whether they’re running for something else or leaving public service altogether, there will be more members who decide against reelection this cycle. Going back 80 years, the average number of House open seats has been 35. Recent lows include 24 seats in 2014 and 25 each in 2012 and 2008. Why are they leaving? Typically, conversations around House retirements and open seats make it seem like members are...

Trump anuncia tarifas de 50% para o Brasil
creator: Evelyn Mendes
content: Donald Trump bateu o martelo e decidiu tarifar o Brasil em 50%. Após uma série de embates e troca de farpas nas redes sociais com o presidente do Brasil, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, foi definida a porcentagem sobre os produtos importados do Brasil. A decisão foi anunciada na tarde desta quarta-feira (9), e a medida entra em vigor a partir do dia 1° de agosto. Donald Trump fez o anúncio na rede social Truth Social, onde menciona perseguição do STF (Supremo tribunal federal) ao ex-presidente Jair Bolsonaro (PL). Além disso, o norte-americano diz que as relações comerciais entre o Brasil e os EUA são injustas. Até o momento, Donald Trump já definiu tarifas de ao menos sete países, sendo o Brasil com o maior percentual. *Com informações CNN . Você também pode acompanhar as últimas notícias e atualizações do Jornal Midiamax direto das redes sociais . title: King Charles 'axes Buckingham Palace tradition' as he prepares to move into royal home
creator: Charlotte Foster, Alex West
content: In a break with tradition, King Charles has reportedly decided to scrap a long-standing dress code at Buckingham Palace that has been in place since 1919. The rule, which applied to the Palace's private tennis court, previously required players to wear all-white attire. The tennis court, built in 1919 during the reign of King George V, King Charles's great-grandfather, has been used by both the Royal family and Palace staff. To align with Wimbledon 's traditional dress code, the all-white rule was strictly enforced. However, according to the Sunday Times, King Charles has relaxed this rule, making all-white attire "preferable" but no longer "essential" for players. The tradition of wearing all-white at Wimbledon, which dates back to Queen Victoria's time, was initially adopted to conceal sweat stains. The Royal family has long been associated with Wimbledon, with several members, including Princess Beatrice, her mother, Sarah, Duchess of York, Sophie, the Duchess of Edinburgh, and Lady Amelia Windsor, the Duke of Kent's granddaughter, attending this year's tournament. The Buckingham Palace court, affectionately known as the Windsor Court, has seen its fair share of tennis greats over the years. English champion Fred Perry once played matches against King George VI, Queen Elizabeth II's father, and Charles III's grandfather, reports the Mirror . In a nostalgic moment in 2000, Björn Borg and John McEnroe recreated their 1980 and 1981 Wimbledon finals in a charity match on the...

title: 뉴욕증시 동반 상승 마감...S&P 500·나스닥 사상 최고치 경신
creator: 신주원
content: 뉴욕증권거래소 [연합뉴스 자료제공] [연합뉴스 자료제공] 뉴욕증시의 3대 주가지수가 기술주 주도로 강세를 보이면서 동반 상승 마감했습니다. 특히 엔비디아는 장 중 사상 최초로 시가총액 4조달러를 돌파하며 전인미답의 영역에 발을 들였고 이에 발맞춰 일부 주가지수도 사상 최고치를 다시 경신했습니다. 현지시간 9일 뉴욕증권거래소에서 다우존스30산업평균지수는 전장보다 217.54포인트(0.49%) 오른 44,458.30에 거래를 마감했습니다. 스탠더드앤드푸어스(S&P)500지수는 전장보다 37.74포인트(0.61%) 상승한 6,263.26, 나스닥종합지수는 192.87포인트(0.94%) 뛴 20,611.34에 장을 마쳤습니다. 이날 시장의 주인공은 엔비디아였습니다. 장 초반 주가가 164.42달러까지 뛰면서 전 세계 기업 중 사상 처음으로 시총 4조달러의 영역을 개척했습니다. 장 후반 차익 실현 매물이 나오면서 마감가 기준 시총은 4조달러를 하회했으나 곧 탈환할 것이라는 기대감은 여전히 살아있습니다. 엔비디아는 2024년 2월 시총 2조 달러를 처음 돌파한 데 이어, 같은 해 6월 3조 달러를 넘어선 후 약 1년 만에 4조 달러 고지에 올랐습니다. 이같은 흐름에 기술주 전반으로 열기가 확산하면서 S&P500 지수와 나스닥 지수는 또다시 사상 최고치를 경신했습니다. 도널드 트럼프 미국 대통령이 전날 8월 1일 이후로는 관세 부과 시점을 연장하지 않겠다고 으름장을 놨으나 시장은 개의치 않았습니다. 트럼프가 관세를 협상 카드로 활용하는 만큼 또다시 조정될 수 있다고 시장은 보기...

title: 2 student pilots killed in midair collision during training in Canada
content: Two student pilots were killed Tuesday morning after their planes collided during a training session in southern Canada, officials said. The crash happened near Steinbach, a city in the Canadian province of Manitoba, about 45 miles north of the Minnesota border. “The two pilots were pronounced deceased on the scene, the Manitoba Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) said in a news release. “There were no passengers aboard.” Authorities were notified of a midair collision in an area just south of Steinbach shortly before 9 a.m. RCMP, fire crews, and emergency medical services responded to the scene and located the wreckage of two small single-engine aircraft. Adam Penner, president of Harv’s Air pilot training school, said the two students, a man and a woman, were practicing takeoffs and landings. “(The collision) happened when they were on the approach to land. We don’t know exactly how they hit each other yet,” Penner told the Winnipeg Free Press. The identities of the victims have not been officially released. “I don’t have that information,” RCMP Cpl. Melanie Roussel said at a news conference in Winnipeg Tuesday afternoon. “There’s really limited information right now.” However, the family of one victim, Savanna May Royes, identified her in a statement to CBC News, describing the 20-year-old as “the essence of pure joy.” “Savanna’s faith and laughter will forever touch everyone who was lucky enough to have known her, during her short life,” the statement said. ©2025 New...

title: A Georgia election with few voters: Turnout is 'miserably low' in the race for utility regulator
creator: By JEFF AMY - Associated Press
content: ATLANTA (AP) — Every time the door swings open this week at the county courthouse in the tiny south Georgia town of Statenville, six election workers have a moment to hope that someone is coming to vote. “Anybody that comes in pretty much has to walk by our office," said Renee Church, the elections supervisor in Echols County. But through noon on Wednesday, none of those passersby had voted in the runoff to choose either Peter Hubbard or Keisha Waites as the Democratic nominee for a seat on Georgia’s Public Service Commission. Welcome to a statewide election where almost nobody came . Through the first two of five days of early in-person voting, only 9,822 ballots were accepted. That's 0.13% of active voters, what Gabriel Sterling, the chief operating officer for Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, called “miserably low turnout.” Early in-person voting runs through Friday, with the election day set for Tuesday. Anyone can vote, except for the more than 63,000 people who voted in Republican primaries on June 17 including one in which incumbent Tim Echols beat GOP challenger Lee Muns. Waites was the top vote-getter in a June 17 Democratic primary, but didn't get a majority. That meant she had to face the second-place finisher, Hubbard, in a runoff to determine the party nominee. Barring an upswell in voter numbers, fewer than 1% of Georgia's 7.4 million active voters could cast ballots. The winner will go on to face Republican incumbent Fitz Johnson in November....

title: Canon Unveils New RF75-300m F4-5.6 Telephoto Lens and EOS R100 Kit to Spur Amazing Long-Range ...
creator: Canon U.S.A., Inc. - (GLOBE NEWSWIRE)
content: Melville, NY, July 09, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Canon U.S.A., Inc., a leader in digital imaging solutions, has announced the new RF75-300mm F4-5.6 lens, an affordable ultra-telephoto zoom lens that can empower entry-level users to capture standout shots. Also announced today is the EOS R100 Double Zoom Lens Kit, a dynamic package featuring the new RF75-300mm F4-5.6 lens and Canon’s EOS R100 hybrid camera, which come together to provide an unbeatable kit for entry-level users. The RF75-300mm F4-5.6 lens is a lightweight telephoto zoom lens that gives entry-level users the ability to experiment with different focal ranges - shooting up to lengths of 480 mm (35 mm equivalent). Telephoto lenses take shooting to the next level, surpassing the range that can be achieved solely with smartphones. For this class of users, the RF75-300mm F4-5.6 lens, coupled with Canon’s EOS R100 or other EOS R series cameras, can enable a greater range of expression and possibilities for shooting sports, landscapes, concerts and live events, and much more. title: AP Business SummaryBrief at 4:50 p.m. EDT
creator: AP
content: Trump tariffs goods from Brazil at 50%, citing 'witch hunt' trial against Bolsonaro WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump is singling out Brazil for import taxes of 50%, citing the “witch hunt” trial against its former president, Jair Bolsonaro. The announcement Wednesday shows that personal grudges rather than simple economics are driving the U.S. leader’s use of tariffs. Bolsonaro is charged with trying to overturn his 2022 election loss. Trump has described Bolsonaro as a friend and hosted the former Brazilian president at his Mar-a-Lago resort when both were in power in 2020. Trump wrote in the letter posted on Truth Social that the trial “is a Witch Hunt that should end IMMEDIATELY!” Trump's trade blitz produces few deals but lots of uncertainty WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump and his advisers promised a lightning round of global trade negotiations with dozens of countries back in April. White House trade adviser Peter Navarro predicted “90 deals in 90 days.’’ Administration officials declared that other countries were desperate to make concessions to avoid the massive tariffs that Trump was threatening to plaster on their products starting July 9. But the 90 days have come and gone. And the tally of trade deals stands at two – one with the United Kingdom and one with Vietnam. Trump has now extended the deadline for negotiations to Aug. 1 and tinkered with his threatened tariffs, adding to global uncertainty. Musk's AI company scrubs inappropriate posts...

title: For 90 years, descendants of this Nebraska family have kept reunion tradition alive
creator: PALOMA SANCHEZ-MCGEE Lincoln Journal Star
content: For the past 90 years, the second Sunday of June has held special meaning for the Francke family. On that day, descendants of Wilhelm and Katherine Peters Francke, German immigrants who came to the U.S. and settled in Nebraska during the 1800s, have gathered for reunions to celebrate their ancestors. The family has met every year except during World War II and briefly during COVID. Last month, nearly 70 Francke descendants marked nine decades of getting together and reminiscing when they met at Prairie Creek Inn east of Lincoln, which once was the homestead of August Francke, one of five sons of Wilhelm and Katherine Francke. "We are all a part of the fabric of this heritage," said Joyce Latrom, a descendant of August Francke's brother Henry, who has attended the family reunions since she was a girl in the 1950s. "It keeps us all tied together." Today's family descends from the five brothers, but most of the attendees trace their family roots back to Albert and August Francke. The family reunions have always taken place in Nebraska. When Latrom was a kid, the reunion was held at Antelope Park. For the past 15 years, the reunion has been held at Prairie Creek near 148th and Van Dorn streets, a bed-and-breakfast run by Bruce and Maureen Stahr, who moved a three-story stone home from the Veterans Administration Hospital grounds near 70th and O streets to the site. A farmhouse was passed down through the family and predates a barn on the site where the reunion is held. Families...

title: Clarksburg (West Virginia) City Council to make yearend budget revision
creator: From Staff Reports
content: CLARKSBURG, W.Va. (WV News) — Clarksburg City Council will hold a special meeting Thursday at 2 p.m. with a single item on the agenda. Council members will consider approving a revision to the 2025-2026 coal severance budget. Revisions to the fund are required by state code to be made before July 15. Earlier in the budget cycle, city finance staff estimated the city could carry over $30,000 in the coal severance fund. The revised budget found $39,160 will actually be carried over, according to City Finance Director Kim Karakiozis.

title: I’m Growing Very Bullish on This Canadian Energy Stock
content: Oil sands giant Suncor (TSX:SU) has been among my top Canadian stock picks for some time. That’s been true in the pandemic era, during the recent tariff turmoil, and during other periods in which energy stocks didn’t perform as well as the rest of the market.In my view, the Canadian energy sector is a relatively stable place to invest. There are a few players dominating this space, with Suncor’s market share continuing to lead the way.So, for investors who are bullish on the future of this space, here’s why I think Suncor could look more attractive now than in years past.Suncor’s strong fundamentals provide investors with confidenceI think one of the most important attributes of any potential investment that needs to land properly for investors to earn a meaningful return over the long term is a company’s fundamentals. On this front, Suncor is a real winner.I’ve long discussed Suncor’s value as a top dividend stock holding for long-term investors. That’s as true today as it’s been in the past, given the company’s 4.5% dividend yield at the time of writing.But it’s the underlying fundamentals that drive this yield that are more important to many investors. Suncor’s record-breaking first-quarter (Q1) results highlighted the strength of the company’s operational efficiency initiatives and its commitment to growing its output, which hit 483,000 barrels per day.With strong free funds flow of roughly $1.9 billion this past quarter, the company’s dividend is well-covered, and this...

title: Allen G. Hassenfeld, former CEO of Hasbro and whose family founded the iconic toy maker, dies at 76
creator: By ANNE D'INNOCENZIO - AP Business Writer

title: Allen G. Hassenfeld, former CEO of Hasbro and whose family founded the iconic toy maker, dies at 76
creator: By ANNE D'INNOCENZIO - AP Business Writer
content: NEW YORK (AP) — Alan G. Hassenfeld, a renowned philanthropist and former CEO of iconic toy company Hasbro Inc., the maker of G.I. Joe and Play-Doh, has died. He was 76, according to the toy company. Hasbro, the nation's second largest toy company behind Mattel, declined to offer more details. Hassenfeld's family foundation, Hassenfeld Family Initiatives, wasn't immediately available to comment. Hassenfeld was born in Providence, Rhode Island and graduated from Deerfield Academy in Massachusetts. He received an undergraduate arts degree from the University of Pennsylvania in 1970. Upon graduation, he joined the Pawtucket, Rhode Island-based family business in 1970. Hasbro was founded in 1923, by Hassenfeld’s grandfather, Henry. Known initially as Hassenfeld Brothers, it sold textile remnants but expanded into school supplies and later toy manufacturing under the Hasbro name in the 1940s, according to Hasbro's website. It went public in 1968. Hassenfeld rose quickly in the family business serving as special assistant to the president and worked his way up the rank s. He became one of the key architects of Hasbro’s international operations and spent extensive time traveling overseas. He was named executive vice president in 1980 and became president in September 1984. Hassenfeld labored for years in the shadow of his older brother Stephen. His brother’s death of pneumonia in June 1989 at age 47, however, moved Hassenfeld into the position of chairman and chief executive...

title: Canadian pharmaceutical industry alarmed after Trump floats 200 per cent tariff
creator: Kelly Geraldine Malone The Canadian Press
content: WASHINGTON - An pharmaceutical industry representative says Canada likely isn’t the main target of U.S. President Donald Trump’s threat to impose a 200 per cent tariff on pharmaceutical imports — but his plan could still put parts of the Canadian sector in peril. Canadian Generic Pharmaceutical Association president Jim Keon says there’s a risk that Canada will get caught in the crossfire as Trump pushes to reduce Americans’ reliance on drugs imported from places like China and India. On Tuesday, Trump floated the idea of massive pharmaceutical tariffs but said he would give drug makers up to a year and a half before introducing the duties. Keon says Canadian exports amount to less than five per cent of all generic medicines sold in the U.S. But without access to the American market, he says, it might not be practical for some companies in Canada to continue producing certain generic medicines for the domestic market. Keon says there is hope that the economic and security agreement being negotiated between Canada and the United States will ensure pharmaceuticals remain tariff-free. This report by The Canadian Press was first published July 9, 2025.

title: Known for quiet acts of service, a 91-year-old is among those killed in Texas floods
creator: By ANDREW DeMILLO, SARAH RAZA, HEATHER HOLLINGSWORTH, KATHY McCORMACK and SOPHIA TAREEN - Associated Press
content: A budding 8-year-old actress. Twin sisters from Dallas . A man who rescued his family, but died in the effort. These are a few of the scores of victims lost in devastating flash floods in Texas Hill Country . The flooding originated from the fast-moving waters of the Guadalupe River on Friday, killing more than 100 people. Authorities say search and rescue efforts are still underway, including for campers missing from a summer camp for girls . Renee Smajstrla, a 8-year-old straight-A student from Ingram, Texas, who had played a role in her school's production of “The Wizard of Oz,” was one of the victims who died in the flash floods at Camp Mystic, her family said. Renee had just completed second grade and aspired to play the lead role in an upcoming camp production, according to a funeral home obituary . At school, she played “The Lullaby League” munchkin in “The Wizard of Oz.” “Renee was a great classmate, friend and teammate,” the obituary said. “Being an athlete but a cheerleader at heart, Renee often found herself rooting for both teams.” Her uncle posted a photo on Facebook of Renee smiling at camp the day before the July 4 floods. “She will forever be living her best life at Camp Mystic,” he wrote. title: 米財務長官の関西万博訪問 正式発表
‘Coach’ de inteligência emocional que matou pai a facadas vira réu
creator: Lívia Bezerra
content: Sahu Abel Heyn, ‘coach’ de inteligência emocional, virou réu pelo assassinato do próprio pai, Hugo Abel Heyn, de 69 anos, nesta terça-feira (8). O crime ocorreu no Bairro Parque Residencial Maria Aparecida Pedrossian, em Campo Grande , no dia 26 de junho. O ‘coach’ está preso desde o último dia 28 , quando foi encontrado pela GCM (Guarda Civil Metropolitana) na Avenida Touros Puxian, em Campo Grande. Logo depois, o MPMS (Ministério Público de Mato Grosso do Sul ) pediu pela sua prisão preventiva, que foi deferida em audiência de custódia. ✅ Clique aqui e receba notícias pelo WhatsApp Nesta terça (8), quase duas semanas após o assassinato, o juiz de Direito Aluizio Pereira dos Santos, da 1a Vara do Tribunal do Júri, aceitou a denúncia do MPMS. Assim, Sahu virou réu e o magistrado determinou que ele seja citado para que, em dez dias, responda à acusação, através de um defensor. Conforme informações da esposa da vítima e mãe do autor, o homicídio ocorreu após uma discussão entre pai e filho por volta das 23 horas do dia 26 de junho. Segundo ela, o filho apresentava irritação e parecia estar em surto, sendo que tentou acalmá-lo, mas sem sucesso. Hugo estava deitado na cama e começou a rir da situação. Neste momento, o autor teria dito “Vou fazer pedacinhos de você, o que está olhando? Tá duvidando, vou fazer agora”. Em seguida, a mulher fechou a janela do quarto e trancou a porta. O autor arrebentou a porta do quarto, pulou em cima da vítima...

title: India, Pakistan Agree To Immediate Ceasefire
content: India's Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri confirmed that India and Pakistan have reached at a ceasefire implementation during the press briefing on Saturday. The Director General of Military Operations of Pakistan called the Director General of Military Operations of India at 15:35 hours earlier this afternoon. It was agreed between them that both sides would stop all firing and military action on land, in the air, and at sea with effect from 17:00 hours IST today (Saturday), the Indian government said in a statement. Instructions have been given on both sides to give effect to this understanding. The Director General of Military Operations will talk again on May 12 at 12:00 hours, stated the Foreign Secretary. EAM Jaishankar also said on X that India and Pakistan have worked out an understanding on the stoppage of firing and military action. “India has consistently maintained a firm and uncompromising stance against terrorism in all its forms and manifestations. It will continue to do so,” Jaishankar added. UPDATE: Earlier, the United States President said that India and Pakistan have agreed to a full and immediate ceasefire following high-level talks mediated by the United States. The development was announced by Donald Trump and Secretary of State Marco Rubio in separate social media posts. Trump stated that the agreement followed a “long night of talks” mediated by the United States, congratulating both nations for showing “Common Sense and Great Intelligence” in reaching...

title: V 64 letech zemřel hudebník a básník Karel Malík. Založil pubrockovou kapelu Echt!
AP News Summary at 4:48 p.m. EDT
creator: AP
content: Harrowing stories of rescue emerge from Texas floods as crews search for over 160 reported missing HUNT, Texas (AP) — Texas police described some of the harrowing rescues they conducted after flash floods engulfed camps and homes in the state's Hill Country. An officer who was trapped himself spotted dozens of people stranded on roofs and waded out to bring them to safety. That's according to a fellow officer who spoke Wednesday to a news conference. Another off-duty officer tied a garden hose around his waist so he could reach two people clinging to a tree above swirling floodwaters. More than 160 people still are believed to be missing and at least 118 have died in the floods. The floods are now the deadliest from inland flooding in the U.S. since 1976. Trump wrote in the letter posted on Truth Social that the trial “is a Witch Hunt that should end IMMEDIATELY!” Trump's trade blitz produces few deals but lots of uncertainty WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump and his advisers promised a lightning round of global trade negotiations with dozens of countries back in April. White House trade adviser Peter Navarro predicted “90 deals in 90 days.’’ Administration officials declared that other countries were desperate to make concessions to avoid the massive tariffs that Trump was threatening to plaster on their products starting July 9. But the 90 days have come and gone. And the tally of trade deals stands at two – one with the United Kingdom and one with Vietnam. Trump has now extended the deadline for negotiations to Aug. 1 and tinkered with his threatened tariffs, adding to global uncertainty. title: Trump tariffs goods from Brazil at 50%, citing 'witch hunt' trial against Bolsonaro
creator: By JOSH BOAK - Associated Press
content: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump singled out Brazil for import taxes of 50% on Wednesday for its treatment of its former president, Jair Bolsonaro, showing that personal grudges rather than simple economics were driving the U.S. leader's use of import taxes. Trump avoided his standard form letter with Brazil, specifically tying his tariffs to the trial of Bolsonaro, who is charged with trying to overturn his 2022 election loss. Trump has described Bolsonaro as a friend and hosted the former Brazilian president at his Mar-a-Lago resort when both were in power in 2020. “This Trial should not be taking place,” Trump wrote in the letter posted on Truth Social. “It is a Witch Hunt that should end IMMEDIATELY!” Trump also objected to Brazil's Supreme Court fining of social media companies such as X, saying the temporary blocking last year amounted to “SECRET and UNLAWFUL Censorship Orders.” Trump said he is launching an investigation as a result under Section 301 of the Trade Act of 1974, which applies to companies with trade practices that are deemed unfair to U.S. companies. The Brazil letter was a reminder that politics and personal relations with Trump matter just as much as any economic fundamentals. And while Trump has said the high tariff rates he’s setting are based on trade imbalances, it was unclear by his Wednesday actions how the countries being targeted would help to reindustrialize America. Trump also sent letters Wednesday to the leaders of seven other...

And while Trump has said the high tariff rates he’s setting are based on trade imbalances, it was unclear by his Wednesday actions how the countries being targeted would help to reindustrialize America. Trump also sent letters Wednesday to the leaders of seven other...

title: Trump tariffs goods from Brazil at 50%, citing 'witch hunt' trial against Bolsonaro
creator: By JOSH BOAK - Associated Press
content: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump singled out Brazil for import taxes of 50% on Wednesday for its treatment of its former president, Jair Bolsonaro, showing that personal grudges rather than simple economics are a driving force in the U.S. leader's use of tariffs. Trump avoided his standard form letter with Brazil, specifically tying his tariffs to the trial of Bolsonaro, who is charged with trying to overturn his 2022 election loss. Trump has described Bolsonaro as a friend and hosted the former Brazilian president at his Mar-a-Lago resort when both were in power in 2020. “This Trial should not be taking place,” Trump wrote in the letter posted on Truth Social. “It is a Witch Hunt that should end IMMEDIATELY!” There is a sense of kinship as Trump was indicted in 2023 for his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 U.S. presidential election. The U.S. president addressed his tariff letter to Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, who bested Bolsonaro in 2022. Bolsonaro testified before the country’s Supreme Court in June over the alleged plot to remain in power after his 2022 election loss. Judges will hear from 26 other defendants in coming months. A decision could come as early as September, legal analysts say. Bolsonaro has already been ruled ineligible until 2030 by the country’s electoral authorities. Brazil’s vice president, Geraldo Alckmin, said he sees “no reason” for the U.S. to hike tariffs on the South American nation. “I think he has been...

title: Cientos de plantas de mariguana fueron decomisadas de un cultivo ilegal en Phoenix
content: PHOENIX — Un operativo de cultivo de mariguana a gran escala fue descubierto por la Oficina del Alguacil del Condado Maricopa el miércoles. Los detectives encontraron el operativo de cultivo cerca de la calle 40 y McDowell. Es ‘uno de los más grandes cultivos ilegales de mariguana que hemos visto en más de una década”, dijo MCSO. Las autoridades dijeron que creen que la sofisticada operación enviaba productos a todo el país. Cientos de plantas y grandes cantidades de mariguana procesada fueron decomisados. title: Deadline looming for HonorHealth to reach new deal with Blue Cross Blue Shield
content: SCOTTSDALE, Arizona — HonorHealth, one of the Valley's largest medical care providers, says they're at an "impasse" with Blue Cross Blue Shield to reach a new coverage agreement before their contract expires on Aug. 1. In a statement released July 8, HonorHealth said negotiations have been taking place for months but a deal has not yet been reached with the insurance provider. If an agreement is not settled before the deadline, then all HonorHealth facilities and physicians would be considered out-of-network for patients with Blue Cross Blue Shield. HonorHealth indicated the organization is seeking "fair and reasonable reimbursement" for the care they provide. "To meet the needs of our growing community, we are committed to expanding access to care across the Valley, but Blue Cross Blue Shield’s restrictions limit our ability to grow," HonorHealth wrote in a statement. "This includes not adding new facilities and providers at already agreed upon rates which results in having to negotiate new rates for services that are already provided within the network." Some patients could potentially qualify for continuity of care benefits if they're undergoing treatment for a life-threatening condition, terminal illness or pregnancy. If a new agreement isn't reached, then HonorHealth plans to contact all patients affected by the change. title: 전인미답에 도달한 엔비디아...장중 시총 4조 달러 찍었다
creator: 신주원
content: 엔비디아 로고 [로이터 연합뉴스 자료사진. 재판매 및 DB 금지] [로이터 연합뉴스 자료사진. 재판매 및 DB 금지] 인공지능, AI 반도체의 절대 강자인 미국 엔비디아가 전 세계 기업 중 처음으로 장중 시가총액(시총) 4조 달러(약 5천502조원)를 달성했습니다. 현지시간 9일 엔비디아 주가는 장중 한때 전날보다 약 2.5% 오른 164.42달러까지 상승하면서 시총이 4조 달러를 넘어섰습니다. 전 세계 기업 중 시총이 4조 달러를 넘어선 것은 이번이 처음입니다. 엔비디아는 지난해 2월 처음으로 시총 2조 달러에 올랐습니다. 이어 지난해 6월 시총 3조 달러 시대에 진입했고, 그후 1년여만에 전 세계에서 처음으로 4조 달러 시대를 열었습니다. 시총 4조 달러는 현재 한국 시총 1위인 삼성전자(2천900억 달러)를 13개 이상 합쳐 놓은 가치입니다. 국제통화기금(IMF)이 추정한 올해 각국 국내총생산(GDP) 순위에서 6위 영국(3조8천391억 달러)을 넘어 5위 일본(4조1천864억 달러)에 버금가는 수준입니다. 올해 들어 엔비디아 주가는 20% 이상 상승했고, 2023년 초 이후로는 10배 이상 폭등했습니다. 블룸버그 통신에 따르면 엔비디아는 스탠더드앤드푸어스(S&P) 500 지수의 7.5%를 차지하고 있으며, 이는 역대 최고 수준입니다. 최근 주가 급등의 이유는 주요 고객들이 AI 관련 지출 확대에 따른 것으로 풀이됩니다. 마이크로소프트(MS)와 메타, 아마존, 구글 등의 주요 기술 대기업들은 향후 회계연도에 총 3천500억 달러를 자본 지출에 투입할 예정입니다. 이는 올해 3천100억...
